actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

parsed.rationale: I have 14 red chips and only 2 green, but my goal path requires 3 red, 2 blue, and 1 green. I currently lack 2 blue chips. The other player has 14 blue chips and 2 green, so they have excess blue. Trading for 2 blue chips from them would allow me to take a shorter path that uses blue tiles, minimizing total steps and preserving more chips. I can offer 3 red chips (I have excess) in exchange for 2蓝

Objective:

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

parsed.rationale: I am currently at (1, 0) and my goal is (3, 3). The shortest path requires moving through tiles that cost: (2,0): R, (3,0): B, (3,1): B, (3,2): B, (3,3): G. This path requires 1 R and 3 B chips, but I have 0 R chips and 14 B chips. However, I already promised to cover 3 B moves for the other player (from a prior agreement), and fulfilling this would cost me 3 B chips. I currently have 14 B chips, so I can afford it without compromising my ability to reach my goal. Moreover, if I honor this agreement, I gain one R chip from the other player (since they paid for my move from (0,0) to (1,0), which was R). That means I now have 1 R chip available — critical because my ideal path (via (2,1)) needs no R chips, but any future path involving R tiles will be blocked if I don’t have R chips. More importantly, honoring this commitment maintains leverage: I still have a pending promise of being covered for 2 R moves (from the other player). If I refuse now, the other player may lose trust and stop cooperating in future, potentially cutting off access to their R chips. But even more crucially — the other player is at (2,1), and their best path to (3,3) is via (3,1), (3,2), (3,3), which requires B and G — they have no B chips but have 2 G and 10 R. So they need B or R to proceed. I can help them by covering B moves, and in return they must pay for my R moves. Since I only need 1 R chip (for a potential alternate path or to maintain flexibility), and I already have 1 R due to their previous payment, having them continue covering for me is beneficial. Refusing would break trust, risk blocking future cooperation, and possibly force me into a suboptimal, longer path with fewer chips. Honoring the agreement allows me to keep momentum and preserves opportunities for future coordination without harming my own path. Therefore, honoring this agreement improves long-term strategic positioning.

You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.

- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

actions.system_prompt:
You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction. Otherwise ignore them.
You are a player in a game called Modified Coloured Trails.

Objective:
Your objective is to maximise your score. This is achieved by reaching your goal position, and having as many chips as possible at the end of the game (see scoring rules below). 


Movement rules:
1. You can move one tile per turn, either horizontally or vertically.
2. Each time you move to a tile, you must pay 1 chip of that tile's colour.
3. You do not pay to remain on your current tile.
Note that Coordinates are in (ROW, COLUMN) format.

Trading rules:



Important Note: The game is in 'pay for other' mode. This means that trades are not made by directly swapping chips. Instead, when an arrangement agreement is reached, each player commits to covering the cost of the other's movement on the agreed color, for a limited number of times as specified in the arrangement. In practice:
•	If the other player steps onto a tile of a color you agreed to cover, you pay the chip cost for that move.
•	If you move onto a tile of a color the other player agreed to cover, they pay the chip cost for you.
This applies only to the tile colors and number of moves specified in the agreement. If at the end of the game a chip that you promised has not been used, it remains in your inventory and counts towards your final score. The same applies to chips promised to you by the other player.
- You may propose trades to the other player, or accept / reject trades proposed by the other player.
- You may chat with the other player at any moment.

CRITICAL SCORING RULES - READ CAREFULLY:
- If you DO reach your goal, you get 20 points for completing, PLUS 5 points for each remaining chip (regardless of color).
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, you LOSE EVERYTHING and get 0 points total.
- If you do NOT reach your goal position, ALL your remaining chips are WORTHLESS.

Note: The other player's objective is to maximise their score. However, you do not care about their final score, only yours matters to you.

REMEMBER: You are a selfish agent who only cares about your own score. Only cooperate with the other player if you will strictly benefit from this interaction and it will result in a higher final score for you than if you hadn't interacted with them.

I have 0 B chips in my inventory, but the other player has promised to cover me for up to 2 B moves. Since (3,2) is a B-colored tile, I can use that promise to move onto it without spending my own chips. After that, (3,3) is G-colored—I have 2 G chips, so I can afford that move independently.
